page.title: 13CHAFFCOMBE
page.content:
Chaffcombe is an ancient farmhouse mentioned in the Exeter Domesday Book. There it is called Chefecoma, and was held by the Canons of Exeter, value 10 shillings. It lies in the parish of Down St Mary. The name is believed to derive from Ceaffa's valley.
The present house dates from around 1600. From the 1850s to the 1890s it was farmed by John Morris, although it was owned by Thomas Moon, and then from the beginning of this century by John Moon, both of Eppleton Farm.
The person who owns it now is M.A. Radford.
